channel.title: CVE Feed for leogermani -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for leogermani -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-3026|2024-08-03T00:53:00.461Z -- leogermani -- wp%20users%20exporter
item.description: The WP Users Exporter plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to CSV Injection in versions up to, and including, 1.4.2 via the 'Export Users' functionality. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, such as a subscriber, to add untrusted input into profile information like First Names that will embed into the exported CSV file triggered by an administrator and can result in code execution when these files are downloaded and opened on a local system with a vulnerable configuration.

item.title: CVE-2024-7135|2024-08-01T18:28:49.665Z -- leogermani -- tainacan
item.description: The Tainacan plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the 'get_file' function in all versions up to, and including, 0.21.7. The function is also vulnerable to directory traversal. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to read the contents of arbitrary files on the server, which can contain sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2024-7135|2024-07-31T10:59:18.370Z -- leogermani -- tainacan
item.description: The Tainacan plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the 'get_file' function in all versions up to, and including, 0.21.7. The function is also vulnerable to directory traversal. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to read the contents of arbitrary files on the server, which can contain sensitive information.
